io.radanalytics.operator.common

Class AbstractOperator<T extends EntityInfo>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.radanalytics.operator.common.AbstractOperator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - entity info class that captures the configuration of the objects we are watching

    public abstract class AbstractOperator<T extends EntityInfo>
extends Object
    This abstract class represents the extension point of the abstract-operator library. By extending this class and overriding the methods, you will be able to watch on the configmaps or custom resources you are interested in and handle the life-cycle of your objects accordingly. Don't forget to add the @Operator annotation of the children classes.

    • Method Detail

      • onAdd

        protected abstract void onAdd(T entity)
        In this method, the user of the abstract-operator is assumed to handle the creation of a new entity of type T. This method is called when the config map or custom resource with given type is created. The common use-case would be creating some new resources in the Kubernetes cluster (using @see this.client), like replication controllers with pod specifications and custom images and settings. But one can do arbitrary work here, like calling external APIs, etc.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity that represents the config map that has just been created. The type of the entity is passed as a type parameter to this class.

      • onDelete

        protected abstract void onDelete(T entity)
        This method should handle the deletion of the resource that was represented by the config map or custom resource. The method is called when the corresponding config map or custom resource is deleted in the Kubernetes cluster. Some suggestion what to do here would be: cleaning the resources, deleting some resources in K8s, etc.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity that represents the config map or custom resource that has just been created. The type of the entity is passed as a type parameter to this class.

      • onModify

        protected void onModify(T entity)
        It's called when one modifies the configmap of type 'T' (that passes isSupported check) or custom resource. If this method is not overriden, the implicit behavior is calling onDelete and onAdd.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity that represents the config map or custom resource that has just been created. The type of the entity is passed as a type parameter to this class.

      • onInit

        protected void onInit()
        Override this method to do arbitrary work before the operator starts listening on configmaps or custom resources.

      • fullReconciliation

        public void fullReconciliation()
        Override this method to do a full reconciliation.

      • isSupported

        protected boolean isSupported(io.fabric8.kubernetes.api.model.ConfigMap cm)
        Implicitly only those configmaps with given prefix and kind are being watched, but you can provide additional 'deep' checking in here.
        Parameters:
        cm - ConfigMap that is about to be checked
        Returns:
        true if cm is the configmap we are interested in

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        If true, start the watcher for this operator. Otherwise it's considered as disabled.
        Returns:
        enabled

      • convert

        protected T convert(io.fabric8.kubernetes.api.model.ConfigMap cm)
        Converts the configmap representation into T. Normally, you may want to call something like: HasDataHelper.parseCM(FooBar.class, cm); in this method, where FooBar is of type T. This would parse the yaml representation of the configmap's config section and creates an object of type T.
        Parameters:
        cm - ConfigMap that is about to be converted to T
        Returns:
        entity of type T
